title: Research
text:
My research involves the development of Bayesian methods for the design and analysis of clinical trials. In particular, I have an interest in robust informative prior elicitation using historical data and/or expert opinion. I also have interests in subgroup estimation and identification.
Below is a list of my published papers (listed chronologically by publication/acceptance date) as well as manuscripts submitted to journals. For works in progress, please refer to my CV.

title: Research
text:
Published and Accepted Works

Statistical Methodology

Ethan M. Alt, Matthew A. Psioda, and Joseph G. Ibrahim. “A Bayesian approach to study design and analysis with type I error rate control for response variables of mixed types.” Statistics in Medicine 42, no. 11 (2023): 1722-1740. https://doi.org/10.1002/sim.9696.


Ethan M. Alt, Brady Nifong, Xinxin Chen, Matthew A. Psioda, and Joseph G. Ibrahim. “The scale transformed power prior for use with historical data from a different outcome model.” Statistics in Medicine 42, no. 1 (2023): 1-14. https://doi.org/10.1002/sim.9598.


Ethan M. Alt, Matthew A. Psioda, and Joseph G. Ibrahim. “Bayesian multivariate probability of success using historical data with type I error rate control.” Biostatistics 24, no. 1 (2023): 17-31. https://doi.org/10.1093/biostatistics/kxab050.


Ethan M. Alt, Matthew A. Psioda, and Joseph G. Ibrahim. “A hierarchical prior for generalized linear models based on predictions for the mean response.” Biostatistics 23, no. 4 (2022): 1165-1181. https://doi.org/10.1093/biostatistics/kxac022.

Allison J. Burbank, Michelle L. Hernandez, Katherine H. Mills, Neil Alexis, Ethan M. Alt, Haibo Zhou, and David B. Peden. “Characterizing Airway Inflammatory Responses to Wood-Smoke Inhalation.” Journal of Allergy and Clinical Immunology 143, no. 2 (2019): https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jaci.2018.12.073.

title: Dr. Ethan Alt’s Personal Website
text:
Welcome!
Welcome to my personal website! Currently, I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Biostatistics at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
Previously, I was Instructor of Medicine in the Divisision of Pharmacoepidemiology and Pharmacoeconomics at Harvard Medical School.


Departmental Profile
My departmental profile is available here, but this website will contain the most up-to-date information.


About this website
On this website, you can find my CV, software, and presentations. I may eventually add a blog.

title: Ethan Alt
text:
Dr. Ethan Alt is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Biostatistics at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. His research interests include the development of Bayesian methods for clinical trials, informative prior elicitation, and Bayesian nonparametrics.
Dr. Alt received a PhD in Biostatistics from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill in 2021. His dissertation was supervised by Drs. Matthew Psioda and Joseph Ibrahim.

title: Software
text:
Below is a list of software I have developed / am in the process of developing. For more information, check out my GitHub page.

hdbayes
hdbayes is a package that utilizes Stan to conduct informative prior elicitation on the basis of historical data. Current implementations are for generalized linear models (GLMs) and include the power prior, Bayesian hierarchical model, robust meta-analytic prior, and commensurate prior. It is currently only available on GitHub.


bmabasket
bmabasket is an R package designed to assist researchers in designing and analyzing basket trials according to the method of Psioda and others (2019). It is available on CRAN.
